conclusion: Consider the energy transformations and effects of air resistance to determine the velocity ratio.
Basketball is dropped from rest at height H, initial potential energy is mgh, initial kinetic energy is zero.
Air resistance force is lambda mg, work done by air resistance during descent is lambda mgH.
Energy just before impact is mgH(1 - lambda).
Velocity just before impact is v = sqrt(2gH(1 - lambda)).
Basketball rebounds to height h, potential energy at height h is mgh.
Energy just after impact is mgh(1 - lambda).
Velocity just after impact is v' = sqrt(2gh(1 - lambda)).
Ratio of post-collision velocity to pre-collision velocity is sqrt(h/H).
Final answer: The ratio is sqrt(h/H).
